snippet: Gunners on an American naval supply ship near the coast of the United Arab Emirates opened fire on a smaller motorized vessel on Monday after it disregarded warnings and rapidly approached.
abstract: United States Navy refueling ship in the Persian Gulf opens fire with a .50-caliber machine gun on what appears to be 30-foot sport fishing boat after it ignores repeated warnings to stop, killing a crew member; encounter comes amid increasingly belligerent warnings from Iran against a buildup of naval forces in the area by the United States.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and ELISABETH BUMILLER
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Elisabeth Bumiller from Washington. Clifford Krauss contributed reporting from Houston.

lead_paragraph: Gunners on an American naval supply ship near the coast of the United Arab Emirates opened fire on a smaller motorized vessel on Monday after it disregarded warnings and rapidly approached.

headline.main: Navy Ship Fires on Boat in the Persian Gulf
headline.print_headline: Navy Ship Fires On Boat in the Persian Gulf

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
